page.title: 02TERLING ARTS AND CRAFTS
page.content: Although many of the old Arts and Crafts have died out, there are still some that flourish in the village. Being a rural farming community, there used to be 2 or 3 blacksmiths, as well as wheelwrights. These no longer exist, but one old Craft has been revived by a retired man, who, as well as making beautiful corn-dollies himself, instructs many others. Another man instructs others in the skill of weaving rush seats for chairs. There is also a class which teaches people how to paint on china. This is now run by the ex-deputy head of our school. Others in the village practise a number of crafts e.g. painting on eggs and stones, sewing commemorative tapestries and spinning and weaving. The standard of Art at the School is high, as is the work entered for the Annual Flower Show.
